message:
SYSTEM: Wiki: La entrega de las prácticas para la convocatoria de junio de 2013 será, como muy tarde, el 1 de julio
Here we include information for the students of the "Máster Universitario en Inteligencia Artificial".
Contents
[
hide
]
1

2

4

Research topics
Objectives

The aim of this module is to provide the theoretical and practical scientific,
methodological and technology basis involved in building ontologies, which will be
used in building applications that integrate, combine and deduce distributed and
heterogeneous information. In particular, we will present:
the concepts of ontology and annotation in the context of Semantic Web, Web of Data and corporate semantics,
the fundamental theory and best-known ontologies;
languages RDF(S) and OWL,
the methodologies, methods and techniques used in its building that include guidelines for identifying the life-cycle, specification, planning, conceptualisation, correspondences, reuse, reengineering, etc.;
methods and techniques for the annotation of resources and significant applications.
Throughout the entire module open research problems will be set that allow students to provide innovative solutions.
Some initial reading to reflect on the objectives:
http://iospress.metapress.com/content/p063121l16757521/fulltext.html
Lectures structure

All lectures, except for the introductory one, will follow this structure:
Presentation (90 minutes)
Discussion about work done during the week (e.g., papers that have been read, assignment that has been carried out) (25 minutes)
Description of work to be done for the following week (5 minutes)
Evaluation

Evaluation will be done on the basis of: RDF(S) and SPARQL work (15%), ontology building assignment (35%), Linked Data assignment (25%) and an optional research work (25%).
Send your hands-on to the following email
ontologies@delicias.dia.fi.upm.es

Hands on activities

All hands-on activities must be submitted by e-mail to ontologies@delicias.dia.fi.upm.es
Additional sources that have been recently proposed
Details about TVE programs:
http://www.rtve.es/api/agrupadores/42170/programas.xml
or
http://www.rtve.es/api/agrupadores/42170/programas.json
For this data source, it may be useful to analyse what has been done at the project
http://vista-tv.eu/
Data from EMT (bus company in Madrid). API details can be provided on demand for those interested on it.
Data from the census of business units in Madrid.
http://www.madrid.es/portales/munimadrid/es/Inicio/Ayuntamiento/Estadistica/Censo-de-locales/Censo-de-Locales?vgnextfmt=detNavegacion&vgnextoid=4ba708e2a77bd210VgnVCM2000000c205a0aRCRD&vgnextchannel=2bd6eea8e3e5d210VgnVCM1000000b205a0aRCRD
Data from the Open Data portal of Zaragoza city council.
http://www.zaragoza.es/ciudad/risp
Press contact information from the Spanish Government:
http://www.lamoncloa.gob.es/nr/rdonlyres/120271bf-7c97-422e-b6b0-3938b9be2e5f/0/agenda2012.pdf
The objective of this hands-on activity will be the design and implementation of a lightweight ontology network to be used for linked data generation, taking into account open and public data in Spanish, the transformation of some of the selected data sources into RDF according to such ontology network, and the linkage of these data sources with resources from the Web of Data (e.g., DBpedia [1], GeoLinkedData [2], GeoNames [3], etc.).
Each team has to select one of the data sources made available in the following list (those are coming from
https://datospublicos.jottit.com/
,
http://alarcos.esi.uclm.es/per/fruiz/pobesp/
,
http://datos.gob.es/
and
http://eufunds.ftdata.co.uk/
):
Dirección General de Tráfico
Censo Nacional de Instalaciones deportivas
. Students must select at least 10 cities from there, which can be discussed with us, whose data should be transformed.
Open data
available at this site. Students can select the tables that they want to transform (Muncipios, Islas, Provincias, Population, etc.). At least 5 tables should be transformed by students, who have to discuss this with us, so that we can avoid overlaps between them.
Incidencias de tráfico
(traffic issues) in Spain. Students should select 5 tables, which can be discussed with us, so that we can avoid overlaps between them.
Financial Times EU Funds Database
. Students can select one or several cities, companies, organisations, etc., from Spain, and obtain data from this online database. Once taken, as this data can be downloaded in CSV format, it has to be transformed.
We will value more those solutions that are more general and that allow regenerating the data without any manual intervention if there is a change in the data sources.
The ontology can be implemented with any of the following tools: Jena [4], NOR2O [5] and the NeOn Toolkit [6].
Finally, once that you have selected the data sources that you want to publish, you must notify them by e-mail to us, so that we record your decision and can avoid overlaps with others.
[1]
http://dbpedia.org/
[2]
http://geo.linkeddata.es/

http://www.geonames.org/
